alert.note: Alert for Cass; Fulton; Marshall; Miami; Pulaski; Starke; White (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 10:00PM EST until December 24 at 7:00AM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow, blowing snow, and dangerous wind chills expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northern Indiana. * WHEN...From 4 PM EST /3 PM CST/ this afternoon to 7 AM EST /6 AM CST/ Saturday. The bulk of the accumulating snow falls tonight into early Friday morning. Widespread blowing and drifting snow is expected Friday into Friday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact holiday travel. The dangerously cold wind chills to 20 below to 35 below zero will cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Cass; Fulton; Marshall; Miami; Pulaski; Starke; White
